Description Details: Functions used to create and visualize a map of the network, identifying all connected devices.
Functions used to enumerate devices on the network, gathering detailed information such as IP addresses, open ports, and running services.
Functions used to monitor network traffic, capturing and analyzing packets for potential security vulnerabilities or sensitive data.
Functions used to perform active network scans, identifying open ports, running services, and potential vulnerabilities.
Functions used to monitor network traffic without active interaction, reducing the risk of detection while gathering information.
Functions used to set up and perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, intercepting and potentially altering network communications.
Functions used to establish a command and control server, enabling control of compromised devices within the network.
Function used to generate unique payloads for attacks, reducing the likelihood of detection by antivirus software.
Function used to automate the process of lateral movement within a network, spreading control from one compromised system to another.
Function used to encrypt data before exfiltration, protecting the stolen information even if it is intercepted.
Function used to disguise malicious network traffic as benign, allowing data exfiltration while evading detection.
Function used to mislead defenders, providing false information to divert their attention while the true operation continues elsewhere.
Functions used to apply machine learning techniques to improve the effectiveness of red team operations, learning to bypass security measures more effectively.
